definition: to be fascinated/to be enchanted
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
to mislead/to lead astray

sentences.english: Such youth and prettiness reacted upon him more subtly than wine.
sentences.chinese: 如此青春的美色，比醇酒更令他沉醉入迷。

sentences.english: It’s certainly the thing that I obsess about the most.
sentences.chinese: 這是當然的，因爲我對這些事情最入迷。

sentences.english: The audience were spell-bound by his playing of percussion instruments accompanied with his singing.
sentences.chinese: 他一手打着簡板，一邊唱着曲，觀衆都聽得很入迷。

sentences.english: Lychee is first of all the fruits, even for a generation of writers of ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 荔枝乃衆水果之首，連一代文豪也爲之入迷。
他們知道我們已經入迷。
全場的觀衆都聽得入迷了。

sentences.english: Are you entranced with the story?
sentences.chinese: 你現在正在入迷讀一個故事麼？

sentences.english: The pupils just drink in her stories.
sentences.chinese: 小學生們聽她講故事可真入迷呢。

sentences.english: His experience is certainly fascinating as you will see.
sentences.chinese: 正如你將要讀到的那樣，他的經歷確實令人入迷。

sentences.english: The natives were crazy about dancing.
sentences.chinese: 這幫土人對跳舞可入迷了。

sentences.english: The world is watching the rise of China and India with fascination and awe.
sentences.chinese: 世界正在入迷而敬畏地關注中國和印度的崛起。

sentences.english: The Mole was bewitched, entranced, fascinated.
sentences.chinese: 鼴鼠如醉如癡，入神入迷。

sentences.english: Chardin delighted him, and Rembrandt moved him to ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡夏爾丹，倫勃朗則使他感到入迷。

sentences.english: He dances in ecstasy and sings.

sentences.chinese: 傑克遜顯然是對杜冷丁入迷了。

definition: to be enthralled/to be entranced
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
vigorously/energetically/enthusiastically
to be engrossed/to be absorbed with/to lose oneself in/to be addicted to
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
selflessness/altruism
infatuated/obsessed
to get carried away/to forget oneself
to become excited with/to be enchanted by
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to become intoxicated
to doze off
